text:
RT @LancasterCC: A ¬£12.1million flood defence scheme to protect homes and businesses on Caton Road and Aldrens Lane has been completed.

Th‚Ä¶

@squirreljack500 @EnvAgencyNW @VolkerStevinUK The flood wall is complete and providing protection to homes and businesses. There is still some more work to do on the overall scheme though, so the cycle path is due to reopen in March. Thanks.

RT @EnvAgencyMids: Our fisheries enforcement officers have been patrolling today at Blithfield Reservoir near Rugeley #Staffordshire. 

Mak‚Ä¶
@LancasterCC @EnvAgencyNW @VolkerStevinUK Great news, so cycle track now reopened? üö¥üèæ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüö¥üèæ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

@TheENDSReport @EnvAgency @ConorMcG1one @360env @ESA_tweets We should deal with our plastic here in this country. You can't be sure it's even being recycled when it goes off to China or wherever, no matter what the receipts say.

@johncurtinEA @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgencyNW @EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgencySW You‚Äôll be greatly missed by all those working to reduce flood risk John. Thanks for all your tireless efforts. Good luck in your future role. 
PS Whose taking up your old post?

text: @moogfood @cerivthomas @Matthew_Wright @EnvAgency spot on. Frequency of stochastic shocks overlay underlying trends in freshwater and marine conditions defines salmon populations. All three are in play and the former is the driver  right now.

Excellent point by @uxbridgewalrus - creating wetland features can be a cost-effective way to reduce flood risk AND providing many other benefits. Looking forward to seeing this reflected in delivery of @EnvAgency new floods strategy @EmmaHowardBoyd @JamesBevanEA #bluerecovery https://t.co/3bEGqVRaqj

@cerivthomas @Matthew_Wright @EnvAgency You only need a few of the "natural" negative variables to sync-up over a few years to take a hit that indeed they can recover from. But repetitive human-driven hits mean a classic decline in the salmon algorithm. That's even without a discussion of the impact on sea ecology.

text: @Matthew_Wright @cerivthomas @EnvAgency We blocked off the catchment, acidified the headwaters, choked the gravels in main stem with top soil, filled the streams with sheep dip and trashed the seas.  1976 was the warning shot on climate, 2018 was as extreme, but now thought normal. Juvenile numbers are coming back.

@Matthew_Wright @cerivthomas @EnvAgency This doesn't help either. unsustainable killing. The maths of salmon survival is quite remarkable. The Wye collapse represents the recorded trend. This is achieved by design, not bad luck. https://t.co/3iGA0HomKW
